conclusion: Analyze the motion of the missile in two phases: the initial vertical ascent and the subsequent curved trajectory.
Initial conditions for vertical ascent: Initial velocity u = 0, Acceleration a = 10g = 100 m/s^2, Height h = 5000 m.
Determine the time to reach 5000 m using the kinematic equation s = ut + (1/2)at^2, resulting in t = 10 s.
Determine the velocity at 5000 m using the kinematic equation v = u + at, resulting in v = 1000 m/s.
Thrust direction changes to an angle θ where cosθ = 1/11.
Resolve the acceleration into components: Horizontal acceleration ax = a cosθ = 100/11 m/s^2.
Resolve the acceleration into components: Vertical acceleration ay = a sinθ.
Calculate sinθ using the Pythagorean identity, resulting in sinθ = 2√30/11.
Calculate the vertical acceleration ay = 200√30/11 m/s^2.
Final answer: Horizontal acceleration ax = 100/11 m/s^2, Vertical acceleration ay = 200√30/11 m/s^2.
